name: Avoid OS command injection
associatedValueName: Call stack from user input source down to the target OS command execution method
description: This quality rule identifies code patterns where user-controlled input is directly incorporated into operating system commands without proper validation or sanitization. The rule uses CAST's data-flow engine to detect execution paths from user input sources to system command execution APIs (Runtime.exec(), ProcessBuilder, system calls, etc.).
output:
List all methods that make resource calls forged by user input

It provides the following information:
 - Method full name
 - Call stack from user input source down to the target OS command execution method.
rationale:
OS command injection vulnerabilities may create severe security risks because:
-Attackers can execute arbitrary commands on the host operating system
-Complete system compromise is possible, including data theft
-Privilege escalation may occur if the application runs with elevated permissions
reference:
CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/78.html

Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) Top ten - Injection category
https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Top_10-2017_A1-Injection
https://owasp.org/Top10/A03_2021-Injection/

OS Command Injection Defense Cheat Sheet - OS Command Injection Defense Cheat Sheet
https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/OS_Command_Injection_Defense_Cheat_Sheet.html

CISQ rule: ASCSM-CWE-078.
remediation:
Primary strategies:
-Avoid OS Commands: use native libraries and APIs instead of shell commands whenever possible
-Input validation: implement strict whitelist validation for all user inputs
-Parameterized execution: Use secure command execution methods that separate commands from arguments
-Principle of least privilege: run applications with minimal required permissions

Specific techniques:
-Whitelist validation: only allow alphanumeric characters and specific required symbols
-Escape special characters: properly escape shell metacharacters if command execution is unavoidable
-Use ProcessBuilder: prefer ProcessBuilder over Runtime.exec() for better argument handling
-Environment isolation: use containers or sandboxing to limit command execution scope
alternativeName: Ensure your application does not run OS command without sanitization
